intro: Physalis comata, commonly known as the woolly physalis, is a herbaceous annual plant native to South America. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-green foliage and clusters of yellow flowers that develop into bright orange, lantern-like fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Its fruit, which is edible when fully ripe, has a tart, tangy flavor and is often used in culinary applications. The species is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
